instructions: 1. Fry the fish. 2. Prepare the sauce with vinegar, sugar, and spices. 3. Pour the sauce over the fried fish.
label: seafood
description: A tangy and sweet Filipino dish featuring fried fish topped with a flavorful vinegar-based sauce and colorful vegetables. It's a perfect blend of sour, sweet, and savory flavors.

instructions: 1. Preheat the oven. 2. Season the salmon. 3. Bake with garlic and butter. 4. Serve with lemon and parsley.
label: seafood
description: A simple yet elegant dish of salmon fillet baked to perfection with aromatic garlic and rich butter. The lemon and parsley add a fresh, zesty finish to this healthy and delicious meal.

instructions: 1. Sauté garlic and onion. 2. Add chicken and cook until light brown. 3. Add vegetables and pineapple. 4. Pour in milk and fish sauce. 5. Simmer until cooked.
label: chicken
description: A creamy Filipino chicken dish that combines the sweetness of pineapple with the richness of evaporated milk. This comforting meal features tender chicken and a medley of colorful vegetables in a luscious sauce.

instructions: 1. Sauté garlic, onion, and ginger. 2. Add chicken and cook until brown. 3. Stir in shrimp paste and chili. 4. Pour in coconut milk and add green beans. 5. Simmer until beans are tender.
label: chicken
description: A spicy and creamy Filipino dish that literally means 'wake-wake' due to its stimulating flavors. This version uses chicken instead of the traditional pork, combined with green beans in a rich coconut milk sauce with a kick of chili.

instructions: 1. Sauté garlic, onion, and tomato. 2. Add chicken and cook until brown. 3. Stir in shrimp paste, vinegar, and sugar. 4. Simmer until chicken is cooked through.
label: chicken
description: A savory and umami-rich Filipino dish featuring chicken cooked with pungent shrimp paste (bagoong). The addition of vinegar and sugar creates a complex sweet and sour flavor profile that perfectly complements the chicken.

instructions: 1. Sauté garlic and onion. 2. Add beef and cook until brown. 3. Stir in tomato sauce and liver spread. 4. Add vegetables and simmer until tender.
label: beef
description: A hearty Filipino beef stew originating from Batangas province. This version of kaldereta features tender beef chunks and vegetables in a rich tomato-based sauce, enhanced with the unique addition of liver spread for extra depth and creaminess.

instructions: 1. Cook beef with garlic and onion. 2. Add vegetables and raisins. 3. Fill pastry dough with mixture. 4. Bake until golden brown.
label: beef
description: A popular Latin American and Filipino pastry, these empanadas feature a savory beef filling encased in a flaky, golden-brown crust. The combination of meat, vegetables, and sweet raisins creates a delightful balance of flavors in every bite.

instructions: 1. Sauté garlic and onion. 2. Add beef and cook until brown. 3. Add vegetables and water. 4. Stir in curry roux and simmer until thickened.
label: beef
description: A comforting and mildly spiced Japanese dish featuring tender beef and vegetables in a thick, rich curry sauce. This curry is distinctively sweeter and less spicy than its Indian counterparts, making it a favorite in Japanese home cooking.

instructions: 1. Sauté garlic and onion. 2. Add beef and cook until brown. 3. Add mushrooms and cream. 4. Simmer until thickened.
label: beef
description: A luxurious and comforting dish combining tender beef strips with earthy mushrooms in a rich, creamy sauce. This hearty meal is perfect for cooler days and pairs wonderfully with rice or pasta.

instructions: 1. Boil beef with garlic, onion, and peppercorn. 2. Add vegetables. 3. Season with fish sauce. 4. Simmer until beef is tender.
label: beef
description: A classic Filipino soup featuring tender beef and assorted vegetables in a clear, flavorful broth. This comforting dish is known for its simplicity and nourishing qualities, perfect for cold days or when feeling under the weather.

instructions: 1. Boil oxtail with garlic and onion. 2. Add vegetables. 3. Stir in peanut butter. 4. Simmer until tender.
label: beef
description: A rich and creamy Filipino stew made with tender oxtail and a variety of vegetables in a thick peanut sauce. This version of kare-kare showcases the gelatinous texture of oxtail, which becomes melt-in-your-mouth tender when slow-cooked.

instructions: 1. Boil beef shank with garlic, onion, and ginger. 2. Add banana blossom and peanuts. 3. Simmer until tender.
label: beef
description: A hearty Visayan soup from the Philippines, featuring beef shanks slow-cooked until tender in a rich, thick broth. The addition of banana blossom and peanuts gives this dish a unique texture and flavor profile.

instructions: 1. Cook macaroni. 2. Sauté garlic and onion. 3. Add ground beef and tomato sauce. 4. Mix with macaroni.
label: other
description: A quick and easy pasta dish that doesn't require baking. This comforting meal combines tender macaroni with savory ground beef in a creamy tomato sauce, topped with melted cheese for added richness.

instructions: 1. Marinate chicken in soy sauce and garlic. 2. Sauté onion and garlic. 3. Add marinated chicken and bay leaf. 4. Pour in vinegar and water. 5. Simmer until chicken is tender. 6. Add sugar, stir well, and simmer for another 5 minutes.
label: chicken
description: The unofficial national dish of the Philippines, chicken adobo features chicken braised in a tangy mixture of soy sauce and vinegar. This savory and slightly sour dish is known for its bold flavors and tender meat.
